rev.comment: This media use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.

Booker writes that the SAR was criticised by [[Frederick Seitz]], who alleged that "more than 15 sections in Chapter 8 of the report â the key chapter setting out the scientific evidence for and against a human influence over climate â were changed or deleted after the scientists charged with examining this question has accepted the supposedly final text".<ref name="Booker-65">{{harvnb |Booker|2009| p=65}}</ref> Part one ends with an account of the signing of the 1997 [[Kyoto Protocol]] and the setting of new targets for reduced {{chem|CO|2}} emissions.
Booker writes that the SAR was criticised by [[Frederick Seitz]], who alleged that "more than 15 sections in Chapter 8 of the report â the key chapter setting out the scientific evidence for and against a human influence over climate â were changed or deleted after the scientists charged with examining this question has accepted the supposedly final text".<ref name="Booker-65">{{harvnb |Booker|2009| p=65}}</ref> Part one ends with an account of the signing of the 1997 [[Kyoto Protocol]] and the setting of new targets for reduced {{chem|CO|2}} emissions.
